Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi,

=C2=A0 The work with NEAT & 2d cellular automata was done circa 2006-2=
007, that was a while ago ^^ The 2011 paper is an heavily reworked chapter =
of my PhD thesis, with more results. The actual NEAT implementation was min=
e, but validated so that is was able to reproduce the original NEAT results=
. For my experiments, you don't have to modify NEAT at all and can run them=
 with the original NEAT implementation. At this time I was, hum, young, and=
 just wanted to code if myself just for the sake of it. The optimizer is NE=
AT, producing candidate neuron network. To compute the fitness of a neuron =
network, I use them as the update function for a cellular automata, and com=
pute how well the cellular automata matches a simple picture. The energy me=
asure metric is a had-hoc part of the cellular automata, NEAT does not have=
 a control on it. The neuron activation is


=C2=A0 CMA-ES, like any ES, is=
 not so found of high-dimensions. One thing is that CMA-ES requires you to =
compute eigenvalues of a NxN matrix, and when N >=3D 100, this is not so ch=
eap, complexity is in O(n^3). Might be more expensive than your fitness ! T=
here are general results saying that,as far as you exploit only fitness com=
parisons=C2=A0 to guide your optimization, you'll be limited anyway in term=
 of scalability, compared to more informed approach, say, optimization usin=
g analytic gradient. So such a scalability issue is not just CMA-ES, it's 9=
9.9999% evolutionary approaches. Thus, using your favorite real vector opti=
mizer (PSO, DE, or Wolf-Pack based optimization or what else is cool those =
days) in the game is not likely to change this. That said, SepCMA-ES (http:=
//hal.inria.fr/inria-00287367/en) can deal a bit better with higher dimensi=
onality than CMA-ES, it does requires you to compute eigenvalues. It's also=
 a tad easier to implement, if you want to
 implement it. SepCMA-ES is less=
 smart than CMA-ES, but in high-dimensions, seems to be more or less same-s=
ame.

=C2=A0 Will try to get a Window machine ASAP, stay tuned...


Alex


=

 De=C2=A0: afcarl2 <afcarl2@...>

 22h24
Objet=C2=A0: Re: Re : Re : Re : Re : Re : [neat] Any Prior Applicati=
ons of NEAT In Which The Genotype Itself Is The Output?
 

=C2=A0 


Alex,
=
In your prior efforts associated w/ the halting problem (2011 publication),=
 when you were using NEAT, did you modify NEAT to compute the energy measur=
e metric, or did you just reimplement the organism activation in your exper=
iment function?
Thanks,
Andy

<html><body><div style=3D"color:#000; background-color:#fff; font-family:ti=
mes new roman, new york, times, serif;font-size:12pt"><div><span>Hi,</span>=
</div><div><span><br></span></div><div><span>  The work with NEAT &amp=
; 2d cellular automata was done circa 2006-2007, that was a while ago ^^ Th=
e 2011 paper is an heavily reworked chapter of my PhD thesis, with more res=
ults. The actual NEAT implementation was mine, but validated so that is was=
 able to reproduce the original NEAT results. For my experiments, you don't=
 have to modify NEAT at all and can run them with the original NEAT impleme=
ntation. At this time I was, hum, young, and just wanted to code if myself =
just for the sake of it. The optimizer is NEAT, producing candidate neuron =
network. To compute the fitness of a neuron network, I use them as the upda=
te function for a cellular automata, and compute how well the cellular auto=
mata matches a simple picture. The energy measure metric is a had-hoc
 part=
 of the cellular automata, NEAT does not have a control on it. The neuron a=
ctivation is</span></div><div><br>  CMA-ES, like any ES, is not so fou=
nd of high-dimensions. One thing is that CMA-ES requires you to compute eig=
envalues of a NxN matrix, and when N >=3D 100, this is not so cheap, com=
plexity is in O(n^3). Might be more expensive than your fitness ! There are=
 general results saying that,as far as you exploit only fitness comparisons=
  to guide your optimization, you'll be limited anyway in term of scal=
ability, compared to more informed approach, say, optimization using analyt=
ic gradient. So such a scalability issue is not just CMA-ES, it's 99.9999% =
evolutionary approaches. Thus, using your favorite real vector optimizer (P=
SO, DE, or Wolf-Pack based optimization or what else is cool those days) in=
 the game is not likely to change this. That said, SepCMA-ES (http://hal.in=
ria.fr/inria-00287367/en) can deal a bit better with higher
 dimensionality=
 than CMA-ES, it does requires you to compute eigenvalues. It's also a tad =
easier to implement, if you want to implement it. SepCMA-ES is less smart t=
han CMA-ES, but in high-dimensions, seems to be more or less same-same.<br>=
<br>  Will try to get a Window machine ASAP, stay tuned...<br><br></di=
